11/ I will return to Washington to share with Speaker Pelosi and President Biden what I saw on the ground.

1447215780324593670.text:

They need to be supported.

1447215778781188098.text: 9/ A large & growing number of my colleagues in congress, as well as our constituents, are unwilling to tolerate U.S. foreign assistance being used to violate the #HumanRights of protesters or murder social leaders & human rights defenders—in Colombia or anywhere else.

1447215777455779847.text: 8/ And I’m deeply concerned about the incomplete implementation of the 2016 peace accords, which provide the road map for addressing long-standing structural problems in Colombia.

1447215775681503233.text: 7/ I treasure the friendship between the United States and Colombia. I want our countries to be close. But I’m very disappointed by setbacks on issues that matter to the U.S. Congress. I’m deeply concerned about the human rights situation in Colombia.

1447215773966077953.text:
6/ What we heard has caused me deep concern.

I was especially concerned by the frustration and fears we heard from organizations that have been fighting for peace for a long time, but today feel that things are going in a wrong and very dangerous direction.

1447215772586192903.text: 5/ We met with President Duque and encouraged him to engage in dialogue with civil society and work with the United States to fully implement the 2016 peace accords. Dialogue is a sign of strength, not weakness.

1447215770686181380.text: 4/ Over the past week, we heard from government officials; Afro-Colombian, indigenous, campesino & LGBTQ leaders; threatened journalists; victims of police violence & their grieving families; multilateral bodies that monitor human rights & the peace accords; & faith leaders. https://t.co/kA8IXuRt83

1447215763430027267.text:

1444020122956484610.text:
Feel the system is rigged against working people and middle-class families like yours?

It is. Build Back Better cuts taxes for families with children, increases the Earned Income Tax Credit, and pays for it by asking big corporations and the ultra rich to pay their fair share.

1444020121815732224.text:
Worried about the future of the planet? 

Me too. Build Back Better creates a brand new Civilian Climate Corps, expands and extends clean energy and electric vehicle tax credits, and more.

1444012650740989952.text:
Concerned about the price of college?

Build Back Better would provide all students with two years of free community college—boosting the earnings of low-wage high school graduates by nearly $6,000 per year.

1444012649562443790.text:
Don't have dental or vision insurance?

Build Back Better expands Medicare to include dental, vision, and hearing coverage so seniors are not left out in the cold when it comes to glasses, hearing aids, or dentures.

1444012648383844356.text:
Having trouble affording your prescription drugs?

Build Back Better would lower the price of your medication, meaning no more painful bills at the pharmacy or delaying important treatments until you can afford them.

1444012647079415826.text:
Struggling with the high cost of child care? You're not alone.

Build Back Better invests in high-quality child care, making it cheaper to get your kids into a great child care or preschool program so you can get back to work and have peace of mind that they're safe and thriving.

5/ I still believe the most enduring legacy of 9/11 isn't in our anger or sorrow, but in the love & kindness exhibited by our fellow Americans.

1436690474862059528.text:
4/ Tara Creamer; Lynn Goodchild; Christopher Zarba, Jr.; Linda George; Robin Kaplan; and Dianne Snyder.

1263917506512781312.text: This is a win-win bill. It would save Medicare money and save lives, and I will be working hard to move it forward.

1263917505577398273.text: When included in treatment plans for individuals w/ complex health conditions, these meals have been shown to reduce overall health care costs by 16%, while significantly reducing the need for hospitalization, ER use & emergency transport. https://t.co/H0jWRWD1GJ

1263917504700841984.text: As of 2016, 62% of U.S. adults over the age of 65 were living with one or more chronic conditions. A growing body of research demonstrates that medically tailored meals can be a cost-effective strategy for improving health outcomes.

1263917503769706501.text: Our bill creates a pilot program to help save money & improve healthcare outcomes by letting medical professionals prescribe medically tailored meals for recently hospitalized Medicare patients that are back home w/ conditions like congestive heart failure or kidney disease.

1263917502826008578.text:
